commits.message:
Fixes EUCA-2275. Improved cleanup for failed Walrus PUT requests.

Walrus PUT request creates a temporary object on the file system, runs checks on this object, and then commits the object.
Moved up policy and bucket size checks on the temporary object to take place before the final object is written to file system.
If one or more of the checks fail, the process errors out graciously after cleaning up the temporary object.
Previously existing object with the same key name, if any, is left untouched. Fixed the same issue for PUT inline (SOAP) requests.
Corrected the object size calculation for the case where its being overwritten.
